What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: 2 hr/week
1hr
The workload is reasonable. Usually 2 hours per week.
2h
Strength: Learned a lot of current topics about biomedicine.
strengths: learning from different media resources
It provides the knowledge of gene related disease and the format of video is interesting.

Strengths: encouraged learning and exploring interests over grades/homework. There is so much media out there to explain difficult genetic concepts, so as opposed to trying to re-create the material, used what was available like high-quality videos. 

Weaknesses: not enough participation among a lot of students who were just on WeChat in the back of the room.

Strengths: This course provides students with a great experience learning in groups. Here I studied the most up-to-date technology and theories in this field. The course structure is well-designed. Starting from basic knowledge in gene area, we learned gradually about more specific and rare diseases, including Alzheimer's disease, vaccines, etc.
Fantastic! It is the perfect combination of genetics and public health and where they merge. Discussion and case based so very practical.
The course is helpful to introduce some interesting or popular concepts related to some chronic disease, the case-based form of the class also encourage your to think critically.

Strength: Definitely Dr. Hoh. She has a lot of wisdom in the field and also knows a lot of people in the field of genetic and environmental diseases. I really appreciated that she asked us for what we wanted to see in the class and opened up class discussions for topics we were interested in. The cases we explored were ones that left me knowing more about the different diseases that are the most prevalent today, and perhaps the most interesting case study was the one in which two students used a 23andMe kit themselves to see truly close science may be. 

I liked the presentations and I actually wish we did more of it. I didn't like the idea of pinning teams against each other, but I did like having multiple group presentations so everyone got to hear a different perspective. I think the class could also be improved in having more discussion of the movies we watched rather than just watching--we leave having questions!

Strength: Topics and materials enabled students to have a general knowledge and think critically
Weakness: would be better if there are more in-depth explorations on the ranging topics
Very fun and interactive contents for each class.
Dr. Hoh is an expert in genetics and she can provide many insights on diseases related to her studies.
Very nice and approachable.

Very much enjoyed her energy and willingness to do anything possible to help people learn about genetics. Got people in class 23andMe kits! Brought treats, had great videos, shared some of her own research.
Professor Hoh is super nice to her students. She usually provided us with helpful and timely feedback and was very passionate about our group presentations.
Wonderful! Encouraging and brilliant.
Professor Josephine is really kind and patient.

Dr. Hoh is the kindest professor I have ever had. The sheer amount of effort she puts into her class was absolutely apparent and it's obvious she cares about all of her students. I liked her presentations and movie format and I thought it was wonderful to introduce us to texts that are popular in the field (such as The Emperor of All Maladies or  The Gene) and allowing us to see clips of videos that took us through history to present of various cases of diseases.
Strength: very friendly and encouraging
I would recommend this class.
A good place to get a brief understanding of genetic diseases
Nice course based on the interest.

I'd highly recommend this if you're interested in genetics. The bonus is that the work load is what you want to make of it, but it's such a fun and engaging subject I felt myself researching more in my free time. Always discussing very current events as opposed to reading articles from 20 years ago, which I really appreciated. Dr. Hoh tries to bring new subjects each class and has her own unique style to teaching that is all about self-discovery.

I will recommend it to another student. By enrolling in this course, students can learn about the most popular topics areas in the gene field as well as learn to explain the underlying reasons of these topics. Really enjoyed it.
I would suggest it for those who are interested in genetics but with no formal background bc it is a fantastic introduction and really places it in the context of public health.
This course could give some intro information of some genetic/environmental disease.

This course is definitely relaxing, not high stress, but does require you to an active participant and to make presentations. I really felt I learned a lot that I didn't know from taking it, and because of that I would definitely recommend to another student.
Would recommend to students who are interested in genetics and other environmental disease. Very interactive and interesting course that inspires critical thinking on multiple health issues.
